title.narrative: VH2- QUALITY, INTEGRATED HIV SERVICES PROVISION (PREVENTION AND CARE)

description.narrative: By the end of 2021, health facilities and communities offer integrated, quality and equitable services for behavior change promotion, testing, Antiretroviral (ARV) treatment and monitoring of HIV viral load among children, adolescents and prevention of mother-to-child transmission, including in emergency situations., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More children, especially newborns, infants and young children reach their fifth birthday. Pregnant and lactating women, children and adolescents (girls and boys) infected and affected by HIV, particularly the most vulnerable, use holistic and integrated quality management and promotion for behavioral change to improve their survival. Fewer children under 5 suffer from stunting and acute malnutrition.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2021, health facilities and communities offer integrated, quality and equitable services for behavior change promotion, testing, ARV treatment and monitoring of HIV viral load among children, adolescents and prevention of mother-to-child transmission, including in emergency situations.

description.narrative: 88% (74011/82700) new pregnant women who attended ANC were screened for HIV with 1966 (2.6%) positive enrolled in PMTCT. 3092 (62% of the target) HIV pregnant women were put on ART (978 from emergency zone). 79% (1340/1691) of children born from HIV mothers were put on prophylaxis ART (450 from emergency zone). Mother to child transmission rate was 14% (89/638) for the beneficiaries enrolled in the program. 10446 children/adolescent screened for HIV out of which 267 put on ART. 35% (3332/9400) of <14 years children living with HIV were put on ART, including 831 under 2nd line. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
